snippet: LAWRENCE--James Vinton, of Norfolk, CT died April 9 of complications from acute leukemia which he fought hard to overcome. Vint is survived by a huge extended family, town committees he enlightened and enlivened, an impossibly large archive of his political drawings, paintings and works-in-progress, dozens of carefully labeled cans of bolts and nails, 16 raised beds, two grieving Labradors and friends who have sustained his wife and two daughters with glorious remembrances. A Memorial Service will be held at 12 noon at the Church of Christ in Norfolk on July 16. 1/3
lead_paragraph: LAWRENCE--James Vinton, of Norfolk, CT died April 9 of complications from acute leukemia which he fought hard to overcome. Vint is survived by a huge extended family, town committees he enlightened and enlivened, an impossibly large archive of his political drawings, paintings and works-in-progress, dozens of carefully labeled cans of bolts and nails, 16 raised beds, two grieving Labradors and friends who have sustained his wife and two daughters with glorious remembrances. A Memorial Service will be held at 12 noon at the Church of Christ in Norfolk on July 16. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  LAWRENCE, JAMES VINTON
